title: How to Make Shenandoah Apple Cake

steps.headline: Rinse and dice the apples.
steps.description: Size needn't be exact, but don't have the pieces terribly large.

steps.headline: Grease and lightly flour the baking pan.
steps.description: To do this, spray-grease the pan and then take a small handful of flour and coat the pan. Shake out excess flour. Alternatively, some bakers find that it works best to line the pan with wax paper and grease the wax paper.

steps.headline: Beat together the oil, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract in the mixing bowl.
Sift together the flour, salt, and baking soda into a separate bowl.
Mix the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until thoroughly combined.
Stir in the diced apples while using the large spoon.
Pour the batter into prepared pan.
Wait until the cake is done baking.
steps.description: Meanwhile you can gather the ingredients!

steps.headline: Add the frosting ingredients to a pan and boil for three minutes, stirring occasionally.
steps.description: Hurry and move on to the next step while the frosting is heating!

steps.headline: While the frosting is boiling, poke holes in the baked cake using a skewer.
steps.description: The more holes, the more the cake will be saturated with delicious frosting!

steps.headline: Pour the frosting over the cake as soon as the frosting has boiled for three minutes.
steps.description: Carefully tilt the cake pan or use a spatula to ensure full-coverage of the cake.

steps.headline: Finished!
steps.description: Shenandoah Apple Cake tastes great either warm or chilled, and especially when served with vanilla ice cream. To store, simply cover and refrigerate. These cakes have a long fridge-life, and taste even better the second day!

text: Making the Cake Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Rinse and dice the apples. Size needn't be exact, but don't have the pieces terribly large. Grease and lightly flour the baking pan. To do this, spray-grease the pan and then take a small handful of flour and coat the pan. Shake out excess flour. Alternatively, some bakers find that it works best to line the pan with wax paper and grease the wax paper. Beat together the oil, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract in the mixing bowl.  Sift together the flour, salt, and baking soda into a separate bowl.  Mix the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until thoroughly combined.  Stir in the diced apples while using the large spoon.  Pour the batter into prepared pan. Bake 350º for 60 minutes. Making the Frosting Wait until the cake is done baking. Meanwhile you can gather the ingredients! Add the frosting ingredients to a pan and boil for three minutes, stirring occasionally. Hurry and move on to the next step while the frosting is heating! Applying the Frosting While the frosting is boiling, poke holes in the baked cake using a skewer. The more holes, the more the cake will be saturated with delicious frosting! Pour the frosting over the cake as soon as the frosting has boiled for three minutes. Carefully tilt the cake pan or use a spatula to ensure full-coverage of the cake. Finished! Shenandoah Apple Cake tastes great either warm or chilled, and especially when served with vanilla ice cream. To store, simply cover and refrigerate. These cakes have a long fridge-life, and taste even better the second day!
